title: Peugeot logo
content:
Does anyone know what font the Peugeot logo is based on?

 [‹ "radnet" rounded sans/"Vsion" hybrid semiserif - Barmeno/??? {Nick Job/???}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821140039/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34382 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) serif face on my website - Monotype Baskerville {Michel Boyer} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821140039/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34345 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jesper

comments.content:
Hello Jesper,  
I think it’s a custom by Porchez Typofonderie:  
 [http://www.typofonderie.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821140039/http:/www.typofonderie.com/ "http://www.typofonderie.com")  
see ya, Kristofer

Thanks man, looks like it’s Peignot ...  
is that you Speedy?

jesper
Interesting observation is that most of the Peugeot printed material uses Gill Sans.
Yep. But I understand them. The multi casing in Peignot does look a bit, well, stupid.
